results.title: Trooping the colour: a famous British ceremony
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films and British Information Services
results.brief_description: An authentic description of one of Britain’s most colourful ceremonies. Includes footage of Queen Elizabeth II, Duke of Edinburgh and Duke of Gloucester.
results.title_for_label: Trooping the colour: a famous British ceremony

results.title: Trooping the colour, 1964
results.brief_description: Newsreel magazine recording the Trooping the Colour ceremony in 1964. Contains footage of Queen Elizabeth II leaving Buckingham Palace on horse to attend the ceremony and appearing on the balcony with 3 month-old Prince Edward and other members of the Royal family at the end of the ceremony. Provides a detailed description and explanation of this famous ceremony.

results.title: Trooping the colour, 1949
results.creator_credit: Central Office of Information and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: Presents the ceremony of Trooping the Colour by the Brigade of Horse Guards on the occasion of the King’s birthday, 9th June, 1949. His Majesty, King George VI, and the Duke of Gloucester take part in the ceremony and the then Princess Elizabeth takes the salute at this impressive ceremony.

results.title: Trooping the colour, [1947]
results.brief_description: Presents the ceremony of Trooping the Colour on the occasion of King George VI’s birthday on 9th June, 1947(?) with the then Princess Elizabeth taking the salute. Also includes segments on the Royal Braemar Gathering, attended by King George VI, Princess Elizabeth and Princess Margaret, and Changing of the Guard. This is a silent film with captions.

results.title: Tron [short version]
results.creator_credit: Steven Lisberger, Donald Kushner and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: This is an adapted version of the feature-length film of the same name. It is a story about a whizkid computer programmer trapped inside a computer world where he is pitted against electronic foes. Featuring some very impressive computer-generated animation. Cast includes Jeff Bridges, David Warner and Bruce Boxleitner. Nominated for Best Costume and Best Sound in the 1982 Academy Awards.

results.title: Trojan warrior
results.creator_credit: Salik Silverstein, David Teitelbaum, Murray Sestak and Triple Three Films
results.brief_description: Featuring Stan “The Man” Longindis (eight times World Heavyweight Kickboxing Champion) “Trojan Warrior” is a comedy action film. Stan plays “Ajax” the good guy who was wronged by police when he was an undercover operative trying to infiltrate the business dealings of local gangsters. His horny cousin, Theo, is wanted by the whole of Melbourne’s underworld and its up to the ‘one-man army’ Ajax to keep him safe. The bad guys want to prevent Theo from testifying at a trial that would put them away for a very long time. Set in Melbourne with some cameo appearances by local identities and with a rocking soundtrack, “Trojan Warrior” is full of fighting, fornicating, farting and farce. Cast includes: John Brumpton, Arthur Angel, Mark ‘Jacko’ Jackson, Henry Maas.

results.title: Trobriand cricket
results.brief_description: A fascinating ethnographic documentary about cultural creativity among the people of the Trobriand Islands. The film shows how the islanders have adapted the game of cricket - first introduced by Methodist missionaries - into an outlet for mock warfare and inter-village competition, chanting and an expression of the islanders’ experience of colonialism.
results.description: A fascinating ethnographic documentary about cultural creativity among the people of the Trobriand Islands. The film shows how the islanders have adapted the game of cricket - first introduced by Methodist missionaries - into an outlet for mock warfare and inter-village competition, chanting and an expression of the islanders’ experience of colonialism.

results.title: Triumph of the will. - [Short version]
results.brief_description: Triumph of the will is the official film record of the Sixth Nazi Party Congress (Nationalsozialistische Deutsche Arbeiter-Partei. Reichsparteitag) held at Nuremberg, Germany, September 4 to 10, 1934. It was created by Leni Riefenstahl at the order of Hitler. The purpose of the film was propagandistic, and as propaganda, it is an historical landmark which may never be equalled. It is also a visually beautiful film - showing the supreme pageantry of the Congress and capturing the enthusiasm of the huge crowds (men, women and children of all ages) who took part. This version is rather disjointed owing to the editing of the original version which ran for over two hours. As an example of German filmmaking of the period, it is unequalled. The various parades and ceremonies are shown and many of the leaders of the Party who later became so well known are seen. Hitler is also shown giving some of his speeches which receive a startling reception. German dialogue with some English subtitles.

results.title: Triumph of the will = Triumph des willens [DVD]
results.brief_description: Triumph of the will is the official film record of the Sixth Nazi Party Congress (Nationalsozialistische Deutsche Arbeiter-Partei. Reichsparteitag) held at Nuremberg, Germany, September 4 to 10, 1934. Leni Riefenstahl produced and directed the film at the order of Hitler. The purpose of the film was propagandistic, and as propaganda, it is an historical landmark, which may never be equalled. It is also a visually beautiful film - showing the supreme pageantry of the Congress and capturing the enthusiasm of the huge crowds (men, women and children of all ages) who took part. As an example of German filmmaking of the period, it is unequalled. The various parades and ceremonies are shown and many of the leaders of the Party who later became so well known are seen. Hitler is also shown giving some of his speeches, which receive a startling reception.
